page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: Because it was and still is an agricultural area relatively few houses are to be found:in the past only farm houses and farm cottages. Nor was there a local village or hamlet.However over the past 10-15 years there has been considerable private house building,particularly around the Newmore School (GR 697717).As a result there are now two distinct types of houses - the old farmhouse/cottage and the new bunglow. The old houses are built of the local sanstone,have slate roofs and wooden sash windows; the houses have two storeys but the cottages only one.Over the years many have been modernised and the evidence is obvious: new extensions atthe front (porch) and/or the rear(kitchen/bathroom),new windows,an upstairs and the like.Often
